page.title: 01UIG BAY AND EARLISH
page.content: Uig is a small village in the north west of Skye. Over the years it has become a tourist attracion with bed and breakfast houses, a youth hostel and two hotels. There is a lot of work at the pier. It is being changed to take a roll-on, roll-off ferry. The village school has forty-three pupils, two classrooms of children aged five to eleven years, two teachers, Mrs. MacPhearson and Mrs. Henriksen, the headteacher. About 300 people live in Uig. Fishing, crofting and tourists are the main industry. Earlish is a crofting township east of Uig. There are 22 crofts growing hay, corn and turnips for animal feeding. Most crofts have animals - cattle, sheep and working collie dogs. There are still one or two original houses in Earlish though modern ones are being built. Some crofts have small boats
